quizzes.title: History Quiz: Words and Country
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, people, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: He lived 1735-1826 and was the first US President to father a President. His last words were Thomas Jefferson still lives.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Adams

questions.question: In what century AD was the prototype of modern sunglasses created?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 12th century

questions.question: I dont feel good were the last words of this famous American. Every time I eat an Idaho potato I will remember  him, especially when I am in a suburb of Los Angeles.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Luther Burbank

questions.question: In what century AD was the underarm antiperspirant deodorant invented?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 9th century

questions.question: His last words were Et tu, Brute?.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Julius Caesar

questions.question: Whose last words were The paper burns, but the words fly free.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rabbi Akiba ben Joseph

questions.question: That was the best ice cream soda I ever had were the last words of this Paterson, NJ born comic.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lou Costello

questions.question: In what country was the vacuum cleaner created in the 19th century?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: United States

questions.question: It did not take The Time Machine to hear this man say his last words: Go away. Im all right.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: H.G. Wells

questions.question: The prototype of the modern toothbrush was invented in this country.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: China

questions.question: Whose last words were not Do not  go gentle.. but Ive had 18 straight whiskies. I think thats the record.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dylan Thomas

questions.question: This Polish-born mans last words were The Earth is suffocating. Swear to make them cut me open, so that I wont be buried alive.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fredric Chopin

questions.question: I should never have switched from Scotch to Martinis were the last words of this actor. Nice words but they are not The Treasure of the Sierra Madre nor fit for an African Queen.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Humphrey Bogart

questions.question: The graphite pencil in its early form was created in this country.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: England

questions.question: The first vending machine was created in the 100s of the 1st century AD. What did it sell?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Holy water

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Record and World
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, athlete, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This winner of the 2003 Thrashworld Skateboarding Vert Award was the first man to jump the Great Wall of China on a skateboard.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Danny Way

questions.question: Who was the thirty-fifth US President?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Fitzgerald Kennedy

questions.question: This team, known as the oldest in professional hockey, set a world record for most goals in a game on March 3, 1920.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Montreal Canadiens

questions.question: Who was the twentieth US President?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James A. Garfield

questions.question: Name the eighteenth US President who was in office from 1869 – 1877.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ulysses S. Grant

questions.question: In 1999 this UNICEF Goodwill Ambassador broke the world record in the one mile run in Rome, Italy.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hicham El Guerrouj

questions.question: In 1988, this recipient  of the James E. Sullivan Award ran the 100m distance for the record-breaking 10.49 seconds.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Florence Griffith Joyner

questions.question: Russian people often referred to Grigori Rasputin as which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: This athlete, awarded The Most Excellent Order of the British Empire, set a world record in womens marathon in 2003.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paula Radcliffe

questions.question: When was Grigori Rasputin born?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 22 January 1869

questions.question: This speed skater, inducted into the United States Hall of Fame in 2004, set a junior world record at the age of sixteen.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Daniel Jansen

questions.question: This Major League Baseball All-Team member made his personal record-breaking 500th home run in June 1960 at the Cleavland Stadium.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ted Williams

questions.question: This heavy athlete, nicknamed The Iranian Hercules,  lifted 263.5 kg (589.9 lb) at the 2000 Summer Olympics.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hossein Rezza Zadeh

questions.question: Which Dutch speed skater, postman by profession, set a world record at the 1976 Winter Olympics?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Piete Kleine

questions.question: In 2000, this man became the first Italian swimmer to receive a gold medal in the Olympic Games, winning both 100m and 200m breaststroke races.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Domenico Fioravanti

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Grigori Rasputin and Death
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, people, actor/singer/writer. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What band recorded the semi-biographical 1978 hit single titled Rasputin?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Boney M

questions.question: Tsar Nicolas of Russia referred to Grigori Rasputin as our friend and a holy man.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Who attempted to kill Grigori Rasputin in 1914?

options.text: a group of nobles led by Prince Felix Yusupov
a group of soldiers led by Nicolas II

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Khionia Guseva, a former prostitute

questions.question: Grigori Rasputin was a controversial figure often accused of which of the following?

options.text: His domination over the royal family

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: According to his secretary, Rasputin wrote a letter in which he predicted his own death as well as the death of Tsar Nicholas and his family.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Della Reese and Lena Horne were born on the same day.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: This famous Cancerian is an all around talented guy. He is an actor/singer/writer who penned a song with Janis Joplin and starred in such movies as Convoy, Millennium and A Star Is Born.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kris Kristofferson

questions.question: Grigori Rasputin was murdered in December 1916. His body was recovered from this river flowing through the city of Saint Petersburg.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the Neva River

questions.question: What emperor of the Julio-Claudian dynasty has an optical disc authoring program named after him?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nero

questions.question: There have been four Cancerian US Presidents up until 2006. One was born 11 July 1767, another on 4 July 1872, one on 14 July 1913 and the other on 6 July 1946. Two of the 4 had fathers that were President and the other 2 also served as Vice Presidents. Can you name them?

options.text: Herbert Hoover, Theodore Roosevelt, Ronald Regan, John Q. Adams
George W. Bush, Calvin Coolidge, John Q. Adams, Gerald Ford
Franklin Roosevelt, John Adams, Warren Harding, Bill Clinton
Abraham Lincoln, George Washington, Spiro Agnew, George Bush

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George W. Bush, Calvin Coolidge, John Q. Adams, Gerald Ford

questions.question: This Roman emperor, often called the wise, is regarded as one of the most prominent Stoic philosophers.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marcus Aurelius

questions.question: This famous American author was born in West Virginia in 1892 but was raised in China. She wrote over 100 works of literature, her most notable one being The Good Earth, a novel about the life of a Chinese farmer.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pearl S. Buck

questions.question: The term The Five Good Emperors refers to five consecutive Roman emperors noted for their virtuous and just rule. Which of these is not one of The Five Good Emperors?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Diocletian

questions.question: As a child Russian mystic Grigori Rasputin was affected by the death of who of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: his brother and sister

questions.question: Tsaritsa Alexandra of Russia called on Grigori Rasputin to cure her only son Alexei, who suffered from this disease.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: hemophilia

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Roman Emperor and Emperor
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, inauguration, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What was president Grants wifes first name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Julia

questions.question: Martha Custis Washington took an active part in politics during her husbands administration.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: How many of Mary Lincolns children died during her lifetime?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 3

questions.question: What was Grover Clevelands nickname for his wife Frances?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Frank

questions.question: This Roman emperor, who allegedly killed for mere amusement and indulged in incest, ruled until 41 when he was murdered by Praetorian Guard.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Caligula

questions.question: This Roman emperor and philosopher, who ruled from AD 117 to 138, was so fond of Greek literature and culture that he was nicknamed Graeculus (Greekling).
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hadrian

questions.question: This best selling author, whose works include Six of Oneand In Her Day, has once said: One of the keys to happiness is a bad memory.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rita Mae Brown

questions.question: Known as the first Roman emperor to adopt Christianity, he turned the ancient Roman colony of Byzantium into a new imperial residence.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Constantine I

questions.question: Randy K. Milholland said: The shortest verse in the Bible is Jesus wept. The only thing wrong with it is the past tense.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The deposition of this Roman emperor in 476 marked the fall of ancient Rome and the end of the Western Roman Empire.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Romulus Augustus

questions.question: What was the first name of Martin Van Burens wife?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hannah

questions.question: Which U.S. first lady did not attend her husbands inauguration because the couples 11-year-old son, Benjamin, was killed in a train accident only a few months before?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jane Pierce

questions.question: Which of the following Roman emperors of the Julio-Claudian dynasty was the son of a Roman emperor?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None of these

questions.question: The first Roman emperor, Augustus, who ruled alone from 27 BC until his death in AD 14, is also known by this name.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Octavian

questions.question: Who played Commodus, the first Roman emperor born during his fathers reign, in the Academy Award-winning movie Gladiator?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joaquin Phoenix

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Redhead and People
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, leader, redhead. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who said: Death doesnt really worry me that much, Im not frightened about it... I just dont want to be there when it happens.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Woody Allen

questions.question: This famous female singer said: I modelled my looks on the town tramp.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dolly Parton

questions.question: This author is quoted as saying: All the war-propaganda, all the screaming and lies and hatred, comes invariably from people who are not fighting.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Orwell

questions.question: This actress said: When things are perfect, thats when you need to worry most.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Drew Barrymore

questions.question: This charismatic leader was King of Germany, Italy, and Burgundy, and was finally crowned Roman Emperor by Pope Adrian IV.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Frederick I Barbarossa

questions.question: Widely regarded as one of the greatest wartime leaders, this red-haired British Prime Minister once said, If Hitler invaded hell I would make at least a favorable reference to the devil in the House of Commons.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Winston Churchill

questions.question: Benedict Arnold once said: A government is like fire, a handy servant, but a dangerous master.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: This red-haired Italian military and political figure has been dubbed the Hero of the Two Worlds due to his military expeditions in both South America and Europe.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Giuseppe Garibaldi

questions.question: This redhead, who entered the English Civil War on the side of the Roundheads, managed to overthrow the English monarchy and temporarily turned England into a republican Commonwealth.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Oliver Cromwell

questions.question: Drew Barrymore said: A fish may love a bird, but where would they live? .
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which American President was NOT a redhead?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Abraham Lincoln

questions.question: Who said: Honesty is the best policy?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ben Franklin

questions.question: This redhead, nicknamed the Virgin Queen, was the last monarch of the Tudor dynasty.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Elizabeth I

questions.question: This famous redhead, who established hegemony over most of continental Europe, was eventually defeated at the Battle of Waterloo.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Napoleon Bonaparte

questions.question: This person said: A democracy is nothing more than mob rule, where fifty-one percent of the people may take away the rights of the other forty-nine.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thomas Jefferson

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: England and William
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, redhead, leader. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This famous redhead is an Apache helicopter pilot in the British Army Air Corps. In August 2011, it was announced that he had asked for a seat on one of the first Virgin Galactic sub-orbital flights.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Prince Harry of Wales

questions.question: William II of England was a very religious king.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Van Heflin played this tailor who became President.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Andrew Johnson

questions.question: William II was which son in birth order of William I, or William the Conqueror?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Third

questions.question: In the 1997 movie, Amistad Anthony Hopkins played this former US President.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Quincy Adams

questions.question: Who was the King of England before William I?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harold II

questions.question: William II (or “Rufus”) of England died in which of the following years?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1100

questions.question: William II reigned England in which of these time periods?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1087 to 1100

questions.question: At the time William II of England was crowned king, Normandy was a part of England.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Which of his sons became king after William the Conquerors death?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William Rufus

questions.question: This red-haired US general, who developed a strong reputation during the Civil War, was defeated and killed at the Battle of the Little Bighorn in 1876.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: General G.A. Custer

questions.question: Who led the revolt against England in 1088 to take the throne from William II of England?

options.text: Henry, the younger brother of William II

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Odo of Bayeaux

questions.question: Name the red-haired leader of the Bolsheviks who led the October Revolution of 1917 in Russia.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vladimir Lenin

questions.question: Which of the following kingdoms did William II of England gain during his rule?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None of these

questions.question: How many children did William II of England have?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 0
